Mahim

Mahbub Islam Mahim

Software Engineer

Samsung R&D Institute Bangladesh

Hi, I’m Mahbub Islam Mahim, a Software Engineer at Samsung Research, where I work on knowledge graphs and reasoning systems, developing a Knowledge Graph build tool using the RDFox engine in collaboration with Oxford Semantic Technologies , UK.


I completed my BSc and MSc in Computer Science & Engineering at Jahangirnagar University, and was awarded the National Science and Technology Fellowship during my studies. In February 2025, one of my research projects at Samsung earned an A1-grade patent, which I’m especially proud of.

Experience

Senior Software Engineer

Samsung R&D Institute Bangladesh
April 2023 - Present

Working in collaboration with Oxford Semantic Technologies on intelligent knowledge graph systems that help organizations make sense of their data. I contribute to building semantic platforms that transform scattered information into structured, queryable knowledge, enabling better decision-making and insights across enterprise environments. Currently leading the development of a key module within the platform.

Patent

Method for Enhancing Wide-Angle Images by Integrating Multiple Fields of View from Different Lenses

A1 Grade
Filing Date: OngoingOrganization: Samsung Research

A novel method that enhances wide-angle images by integrating multiple fields of view from different lenses, providing superior image quality and expanded visual coverage. This innovation was graded A1 by Samsung Research on February 20, 2025, representing the highest level of technical excellence and commercial potential.

Research & Publications

🏆

Divide and Conquer: A Two-Stage Cascaded Framework with K-Fold Ensembling for Multi-Label Bangla Hate Speech Classification

BLP Shared Task 1 @ AACL-IJCNLP 2025• Conference Paper

Designed a label-wise cascaded pipeline where each label is first classified using a binary model and then refined with a multiclass model, with k-fold cross-validation and intra-label ensembling. Became CHAMPION in the workshop contest and currently writing for BEST PAPER award.

View Paper
📝

Optimizing the Fine‑Tuning Process of Large Language Models

Jahangirnagar University Journal of Electronics and Computer Science, Vol.16, June 2025• Journal Article

A comprehensive comparison of a memory-efficient fine-tuning method that combines quantization and LoRA on LLaMA-2 7B using the CodeAlpaca-20k dataset, reducing GPU memory usage from 112 GB to 10.8 GB without sacrificing performance, thereby enabling low-resource LLM deployment in real-world applications such as coding assistants.

View Paper
📝

Enhancing Wide‑Angle Image Using Narrow‑Angle View of the Same Scene

arXiv preprint arXiv:2504.09455, April 2025• Preprint

Developed a GAN-based approach to enhance wide-angle images by fusing fine details from co-captured narrow-angle views, leveraging attention-based feature integration to improve visual fidelity.

View Paper
